briefTitle: Chemotherapy in Treating Patients With Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
officialTitle: A Randomized Phase 3 Study Comparing Pemetrexed-Carboplatin With Docetaxel-Carboplatin as First-Line Treatment for Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the combination of pemetrexed and carboplatin with the combination of docetaxel and carboplatin in terms of survival without Grade 3 or 4 toxicity in previously untreated patients with locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline to until 218 events (defined as death or Grade 3 or 4 toxicity) have been observed (up to 33.3 months).
